topic.title: ZeroNet vs. DAT://
topic.body: A few days ago I found out about ZeroNet and I think is genius idea . I was wondering, other then p2p ,what's the difference between ZeroNet end DAT(it comes with Beaker browser) ?

1565197761_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehE.body:
> [zeronetanon4](#comment_11_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v): The fearmongering against the service is exactly why I'll have it running 24/7 into the future.  The more disruptive a technology is, the more you can expect this type of artificial reaction from shills.

That's exactly what I'm going to do, I'm going to build a small machine that runs 24/7. I'm thinking about something with passive cooling because I don't want to hear it all night :D

> [nickwa](#comment_231_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehEEKKJj): Raspberry pi. I mean if you want really small.

That's actually a better idea thanks

1565272923_1NFJShBdHywQbAzqKUVzAv4Qekh1B.body: The problem I see with video sharing is that the files are too big so you run out of space pretty fast.

> [zerodud](#comment_10_1NFJShBdHywQbAzqKUVzAv4Qekh1BkXRR9): 4k movie torrents that are 10~20gb are getting very popular now, its not about size, its about amount of users.

I get that and I agree but my point is this only works if people are willing to share TB of space on their hard drives plus the traffic that's comes with that.
